documents.t: Where trustful interaction meets trustless code

Intuition is building the world’s first open and semantic knowledge graph, decoupling data and algorithms from the application layer. This universal and permissionless data lake opens the door to a new pillar of the decentralized web - a ‘trustful interaction layer’, capable of handling both objective facts and subjective opinions, where people and machines have the data they need, when they need it - forever changing the way the web is interacted with and developed. Intuition was created to address the limitations of current digital trust systems, where centralized models have resulted in large, inaccessible data silos prone to misuse, raising concerns over privacy and transparency. By embracing decentralized technologies, Intuition offers a new model for trust and identity verification that prioritizes user empowerment, data integrity, and open access.

At it’s core, Intuition is building a knowledge and social graph that integrates incentive-driven mechanisms, decentralized identifiers, and semantic data structures to lay the foundation for a trustworthy internet. With the introduction of novel primitives, Intuition unlocks the ability to operationalize trust at an unprecedented scale. The platform provides applications and their users easy access to a trust-based interaction layer where both objective facts and subjective opinions can coexist and be validated, fostering informed decision-making and enhancing the security of digital interactions. Key Innovations: Incentive-driven Social Consensus: Intuition uses economic incentives to drive consensus around globally recognized identifiers, promoting uniformity in data representation. Deterministic and Non-deterministic Attestations: Intuition facilitates the creation of objective and subjective attestations, encouraging users to contribute valuable data. Standardization of Attestation-based Expression: The platform incentivizes standardization in data formats, enhancing interoperability and semantic richness. Permissionless Interpretations: Intuition supports a diverse ecosystem of interpretations, promoting innovation and flexible data use. We believe in a future of data and knowledge where information is not just stored but made verifiable, wrapped in a semantic embrace, mapped by a directed graph of state changes captured on an immutable ledger.
documents.s: Where trustful interaction meets trustless code

documents.t: With Intuition, developers can create applications that empower users with full control over their identities and data, enhancing privacy and security. Intuition’s composable and semantic data structure allows for seamless integration and interoperability across diverse systems, enabling developers to build scalable, sophisticated applications that interact smoothly within the decentralized ecosystem. Building with Intuition positions developers at the cutting edge of creating a more secure, user-centric digital future, providing access to a network of verifiable data enabling the creation of reputation and trust across the digital realm. Verifiable claims and attestations created and revoked through a user-friendly API Attestation aggregation infrastructure that enables complex reputation use cases Advanced query functionality that enables search through a unified, decentralized registry of identity data The platform supports permissionless innovation, giving developers the freedom to explore and implement new approaches to data management and presentation without the constraints of centralized control. With Intuition’s open and interoperable design, developers can contribute to and benefit from a collaborative ecosystem where their innovations are valued and rewarded.

Also referred to as Identities, Atoms are the atomic unit of knowledge in Intuition, representing singular objects or concepts, such as a word, an entity, a meme; any ‘thing’. There are four distinct ways users can interact with Atoms: Creating an Atom Depositing (staking) on an Atom - remember, this is a Signal! Composing a Triple from three Atoms Depositing (staking) on an Triple - also a Signal!

Intuition is an ecosystem of technologies composing a universal and permissionless knowledge graph, capable of handling both objective facts and subjective opinions. While Intuition’s delivering superior data for intelligences across the spectrum, from human to artificial.

Intuition’s initial flagship application, Explore, allows users to create, navigate, aggregate, and curate attestations regarding people and things within the web3 ecosystem, a space where qualitative reputation and identity data is acutely lacking. Leveraging users’ social graphs (i.e., the people and organizations they “follow”) and distributed trust algorithms (e.g., EigenTrust), the application will be able to prioritize the display of relevant activity and tailor attestation weighting.

Although we’re building in-house applications to help demonstrate our infrastructure, our primary goal is to facilitate a healthy ecosystem of developers and partners integrating, building and experimenting on top of Intuition. Our API & SDK allow developers to quickly replace existing functionality with attestations, adding to the visibility, utility and incentives associated with data that is already being created. E.g., a “thumbs up” in a product hunt for web3 app, or a “like” tied to content on a social platform can easily exist on Intuition’s open graph instead of within app-specific silos. The resulting data can then easily be queried and displayed within apps.

At the infrastructure level, Intuition remains completely unopinionated. We allow anyone to make any attestation about anything, incentivizing the creation of useful data, and then making it easy to navigate the resulting data. Users can search for a given person or smart contract to see what has been claimed or can alternatively query a set of tags to see a list of entities meeting those criteria. Intuition doesn’t opine on whether a claim is true or false, but rather displays what people are saying about a thing while providing tools to help analyze and filter.

The Intuition System is built on a set of novel primitives, which form the foundation of the ecosystem and enable the creation of a structured, semantic web of trust. remarque Intuition introduces three new primitives: Atoms: Intuition’s atomic unit of knowledge, enabling unique, persistent, canonical identifiers for all things - not just people. Triples: A composition of Atoms - defined as Semantic Triples which represent the relationships between Atoms Signal: The weight of Atoms and Triples, derived from the total amount of ETH deposited in Atom and Triple Vaults

Atoms are the most basic units of knowledge within Intuition, functioning as unique, globally persistent, decentralized identifiers for all things—people, concepts, products, and more. Each Atom serves as a building block for more complex data structure and facilitates the deterministic and semantic organization of information within the knowledge graph.

The digital universe is vast, where everything from tangible objects to abstract concepts can be endowed with a digital identity. Identities confer unique recognition and definition to persons, places, ideas, or even memes, ensuring each entity's distinct presence. Within Intuition, every Identity is secured by a unique DID (Decentralized Identifier) and an Ethereum wallet address, establishing a verifiable foundation. Identities are categorized into three primary roles within semantic structures: Subjects, Predicates, and Objects. This structure facilitates the creation of Claims that articulate specific assertions or facts about the world. Let's look at an example in the format of Subject - Predicate - Object: **Alice** [Subject] **- hasAccessTo** [Predicate] **- Intuition** [Object] Alice is the Subject hasAccessTo is the Predicate Intuition is the Object Further illustrating the flexibility of Identities, Intuition can also act as a Subject: **Intuition** [Subject] - **is a** [Predicate] - **Ethereum-based attestation protocol** [Object] This claim demonstrates Intuition's role and essence in a semantic, structured format.

Acknowledging the potential for any entity to hold a digital identity opens the door to collaboratively crafting an expansive knowledge graph. By arranging Identities into Claims—semantic triples of Subject, Predicate, Object—we co-create a graph mapping out entities' interrelations and factual, verifiable assertions about the world. The journey within Intuition starts with an Identity. Engaging with this concept might begin by identifying entities within your realm of knowledge that fit neatly into the categories of Subjects, Predicates, or Objects. This process is a first step toward contributing to our collective mission: building a collaborative knowledge graph demonstrating the connections and relationships among all entities

Atom Data: Describes the concept or entity represented by an Atom, typically stored off-chain using decentralized storage solutions like IPFS or Arweave, with a URI pointing to this data stored on-chain. Atom Wallet: A smart contract wallet associated with each Atom, granting it agency over its identity. This wallet is controlled by a specialized smart contract known as the Atom Warden Atom Vault: A mechanism that allows users to deposit tokens into an Atom, signaling its relevance and support within the system. The Total Value Locked (TVL) in an Atom Vault indicates the Atom’s acceptance and importance.

Triples are higher-order structures within Intuition, used to define relationships between Atoms. Each Triple consists of three components: a Subject, Predicate, and Object, all of which are Atoms. This structure enables precise, machine-readable representations of data, facilitating complex and interconnected attestations. Triple Structure: Subject: The entity or concept being described. Predicate: The relationship or attribute of the subject. Object: The value or characteristic attributed to the subject. astuce Triples can be used as Atoms in other Triples, allowing for the expression of arbitrarily complex statements in a standardized format.

Signal in Intuition refers to any action that expresses intent, belief, or support within the system. Signals can be explicit, such as voting mechanisms or signed attestations, or implicit, inferred from user behavior.

Users hold positions on Atoms and Triples, signaling their stance by increasing their balance on the relevant entities. Signals contribute to the nuanced expression of trust and belief, allowing for a dynamic and tiered system of preferences within the decentralized ecosystem. It is important to note that creating an Atom or Triple is distinctly different from taking a position on them. While users have the option to both create and take a position on an Atom/Triple at the time of creation, this Initial Deposit is not required. A user who makes no Initial Deposit will only create an Atom or Triple, which does not constitute a Signal. The next three pages go into detail on the types of interactions users can have with these primitives.

A trustful interaction refers to a digital exchange where participants can engage with confidence, knowing that the system and the other parties involved are reliable, transparent, and secure. In the context of the Intuition platform, trustful interactions are characterized by several key elements:

Verification and Transparency: Verifiability: Information and actions within the system can be verified by all parties involved. This means that data integrity is maintained through cryptographic proofs, ensuring that what is claimed is accurate and can be validated independently. Transparency: The processes and mechanisms of the interaction are open and transparent. Users can see and understand how decisions are made and data is handled. Security and Privacy: Security: Interactions are protected against tampering, fraud, and unauthorized access through robust cryptographic techniques. Privacy: Users' data is handled in a way that respects their privacy, ensuring that sensitive information is not exposed or misused. Decentralization: Decentralized Trust: Trust is not concentrated in a single entity or authority but is distributed across a network. This reduces the risk of single points of failure and increases the system's resilience. Peer-to-Peer Verification: Trust is established directly between participants through decentralized protocols, without the need for intermediaries. Economic Incentives: Aligned Interests: Participants are economically incentivized to act in the best interests of the network. Mechanisms like staking and bonding curves ensure that users who contribute positively are rewarded, while those who act maliciously are penalized. User Empowerment: Control Over Data: Users have full control over their data and digital identities. They decide how their information is used and who has access to it. Informed Decisions: Access to reliable and relevant data enables users to make informed decisions, reducing the uncertainty typically associated with digital interactions.

Financial Transactions: A user can confidently send money to another party, knowing that the transaction will be securely processed and that the recipient is verified and trustworthy. Healthcare Data Sharing: A patient can share their medical records with a new healthcare provider, assured that their data will be securely transmitted and only accessible to authorized individuals. Voting Systems: Voters can participate in an election through a decentralized voting system, confident that their votes are accurately counted and that the system is tamper-proof. E-commerce Reviews: Customers can trust the reviews and ratings of products on an e-commerce platform, knowing that these reviews are verified and free from manipulation. By leveraging verifiability, transparency, security, decentralization, economic incentives, and user empowerment, the platform creates an environment where digital interactions are as trustworthy as possible. This transformation is essential for enhancing confidence and efficiency in various digital domains, from finance and healthcare to governance and beyond.

Identity Typically referenced as a combination of 1) an identifier, and 2) data describing that identifier. In the case of Intuition, an ‘identity’ is an aggregate of data describing an [Atom]. This aggregate may be relative and/or contextual User An agent in the system that has performed / is capable of performing on-chain transaction(s) Vault ERC-4626 - Tokenized Vault Standard. The method through which users are able to ‘signal’ their ‘conviction’ about ‘things’ Multi-Vault Extension of ERC-4626 Tokenized Vault Standard, wherein many Vaults can be managed by a singular contract (instead of needing a new contract for each vault) Signal Informative data created by or about an Atom. Variables that may be included in the derivation of Signal include any action taken by, or any action referencing, an Atom. Example variables include: the creation of an Atom or Triple, staking on an Atom or Triple’s Vaults, the duration of this stake, the time of each action, the reputation of each agent involved, etc. User Signal Signal created by or about an Atom that is also defined as a User (i.e. an Atom that has performed some on-chain transaction in the Intuition system, demonstrating agency). Stake (AKA “Attesting”) The process by which a user signals their conviction in an Atom or Triple. “Staking” involves depositing tokens into a [Triple]’s [Vault]. “Signaling” of a “thing” may be arbitrarily observed as the amount of [Stake] an entity is presently [Staking] on that thing Counter-Stake [Staking] on the [Negative Vault] of a [Triple]. All [Triples] have two [Vaults] - one for the “affirmative” of the Triple’s statement, and one for the “negative” / “inverse”. [Counter-Staking] involves staking on the “negative” / “inverse” Vault of a Triple. Example: the [Triple]: [Billy][is] [Trustworthy] has 2 vaults; if a user wishes to signal that this Triple is false, they would [Counter-Stake] on the [Triple], by [Staking] on the [Negative Vault] of the [Triple]. Indexer A thing that grabs data from one place and indexes it in another place. On-Chain Indexer A thing that grabs data from on-chain and indexes it somewhere else. Off-Chain Indexer A thing that grabs data from somewhere off-chain and indexes it somewhere else. Interpretation Akin to language, interpretations are agreed upon methods by which state in the Intuition system can be interpreted. Any data can be interpreted in any way; however, reusable interpretations and interpretation models enable deeper cooperation between higher-level actors. Official Interpretation An [Interpretation] that has an officially-approved meaning, as approved by the Intuition community. For example, a [Triple] having a “hasAccess” [Predicate] may have an [Official Interpretation] of granting the user access to something. DID Decentralized identifier as defined by the W3C DID spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/ VC Verifiable Credential as defined by the W3C VC spec: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/ Atom Shares [Atom Shares] grant users a proportional share of all [Atom Fees] paid to the [Atom]. [Atom Shares] are shares of the [Atom’s][Vault]. Triple Shares [Triple Shares] grant users a proportional share of all [Triple Fees] paid to the [Triple]. [Triple Shares] are shares of the [Triple’s][Vault]. Protocol Shares [Protocol Shares] grant users a proportional share of all [Protocol Fees] paid to the [Protocol]. [Protocol Shares] are shares of the [Protocol’s][Vault]. Protocol Fee The portion of the fee paid to the [Protocol] whenever an action is performed in the Intuition system. The [Protocol Fee] is distributed to Shareholders of the Protocol / [Protocol Share] holders. [Protocol Shares] are obtained by paying [Fees]. Fee Rewards The proportion of the [Fee] that is paid to Shareholders of the respective object. Bonding Curve Equation that dictates the cost of shares in an object based upon the supply of those shares. Generally, the more shares outstanding, the higher the cost of subsequent shares.

Intuition is building a powerful and versatile ecosystem of apps and developer tooling on top of the world’s first open and semantic knowledge graph. This new data layer makes it easy for anyone to capture and curate verifiable social wisdom free from the limitations of application specific silos. This documentation is your comprehensive guide to making the most of our early solution stack and includes all the resources you need to join like-minded pioneers in advancing the vision of the Semantic Web. astuce By refining, expressing, and managing identity and data Intuition aims to give entities better ‘intuition’ in all their interactions, ultimately enhancing the trustworthiness of the entire digital ecosystem.

Intuition is a peer-to-peer knowledge sharing ecosystem with features to support utility in Web3 and beyond. Decentralized Identifiers: Introducing unique, persistent, canonical identifiers for all things - not just people. Traversable Attestations: Many-to-one attestations that are uniquely structured to make verifiable data eminently more discoverable and usable. Data Neutrality Framework: Open, transparent standards fostering an ecosystem where data and services can interact without barriers or bias, promoting innovation, competition, fairness, and truth. Chain-Agnostic Access: An open, permissionless data lake accessible by all. Incentivized Standards: Rewards for creating and curating useful information interacted with by others, facilitating engagement and enhancing quality.

This documentation is intended for: New Users: If you're new to [Your Application Name], this guide will help you get started, set up your account, and begin using the application effectively. Experienced Users: If you're already familiar with our application, this documentation serves as a valuable resource for advanced configurations, best practices, and troubleshooting. Administrators: For administrators responsible for managing [Your Application Name] within an organization, you'll find sections specifically dedicated to user management, security, and customization.

To make the most of this documentation, you can follow these guidelines: Search: Use the search bar to quickly find information on specific topics. Navigation: The documentation is organized into sections, so you can navigate through the table of contents to locate the information you need. Links: We've included links to related articles and resources for in-depth exploration. Feedback: If you can't find the information you're looking for or have suggestions for improvement, please let us know.

If you encounter any issues or have questions not covered in this documentation, our dedicated support team is here to assist you. Contact us at [Support Email or Phone Number] or visit our support portal at [Support Portal URL]. We're excited to have you on board and look forward to helping you make the most of our application!

Web3 Wallets Real time web3 and smart contract reputation integrations - is this contract or EOA safe to interact with? Browser Plugins Bring omni-reputation to the internet - is this twitter user a subject matter expert? Curation of Things What services or products are recommended by trusted sources Community Formation Gate or organize communities by demonstrable criteria - joinable by users of a certain attestation score Reputation of Identities Deeper insights into an individual or trackable information about things Social Media Abstraction Instant claim creation when a user interacts with an emote 👍
